Description.val:
Ground/Air Task Oriented Radar (G/ATOR AN/TPS-80) - The Ground/Air Task Oriented Radar is a multi-role, ground-based, expeditionary radar that replaces five legacy radar systems for the Marine Air Ground Task Force.
It satisfies the Marine Air Command and Control System (G/ATOR Block 1) and the Ground Counter Fire/Counter Battery (G/ATOR Block 2) capabilities. The G/ATOR replaces the AN/TPS-63 and complements the AN/TPS-59 long range radar and will provide mobile, multi-functional, three-dimensional surveillance of air breathing targets, detection of cruise missiles and Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS), and the cueing of air defense weapons. The G/ATOR contributes to the extension of Sea Shield/Sea Strike through surveillance and detection of enemy air threats not seen by Navy sensors in the littorals by participating in a cooperative engagement network of sensors and shooters; G/ATOR enables Integrated Fire Control (IFC) and provides engage/fire on remote capability. G/ATOR surveillance coverage with IFC will provide unprecedented reach, volume, and precision in the execution of Operational Maneuver From The Sea allowing Naval forces to project and sustain power deep inland. Prior year funding and quantities for the G/ATOR program can be found in BLI 4650 - Radar Systems.

Justification.val:
FY 2019 $220.416M ($94.506M Active; $125.910M Reserves)
AN/TPS-80 G/ATOR - FY19 funded the initial Full Rate Production (FRP) Lot of six (6) G/ATOR systems and provided logistic/program support associated with the procurement of systems, hardware, program management and logistics required for G/ATOR fielding related activities. The FY19 Active/Reserve breakdown cited here represents current funding levels post a realignment that is not yet reflected in the Secondary Distribution table on Pg 1.  

FY 2020 $273.022M ($151.175M Active; $121.847M Reserves)
AN/TPS-80 G/ATOR - FY20 funding procures eight (8) G/ATOR systems and provide logistic/program support associated with the procurement of systems, hardware, program management and logistics required for G/ATOR fielding related activities. The FY20 column of the FY21 submit has been updated based upon the award of G/ATOR's FRP Contract.  The contract is Firm Fixed Price (FFP) with contractor Systems Engineering Program Management (SEPM) embedded in the cost of the contract. The systems unit price savings reduces the total cost of 8 systems. The cost savings has been applied towards a one-time Diminishing Manufacture Sources/Non-Reccurring Engineering and Communication Equipment Group (CEG) Shelter Integration requirement covering known diminishing manufacturing sources/material shortages (DMS/MS) issues, the procurement of CEG shelters, the procurement of Power Equipment Group (PEG) Pallets, an increase to Logistics Support and Engineering Change Orders (ECO's) supporting Pallet Communications Support Processor (PCSP) and GB2 Hardware improvements with a focus on reducing Radar Emplacement/Displacement time.    

FY 2021 Base Appropriation Request $284.283M ($284.283M Active; $0.0M Reserves)
AN/TPS-80 G/ATOR - FY21 funding will procure eight (8) G/ATOR systems and provide logistic/program support associated with the procurement of systems, hardware, program management, and logistics required for G/ATOR fielding related activities. The increase in funding from FY20 to FY21 primarily reflects the procurement of Gallium Nitride (GaN) Retrofit Kits to modify three (3) Gallium Arnside (GaAS) LRIP Radars to the GaN configuration, the initiation of radar decoys procurement and the initiation of Depot stand-up activities, specifically, the procurement of the tooling for the G/ATOR Depot at Tobyhanna Army Depot.

Name.@footnote: System Unit Cost for FY19 changed from $29.839M to $31.477M based on G/ATOR FRP Contract Award. System Unit Cost for FY20 changed from $29.835M to $28.160M based on G/ATOR FRP Contract Award. System Unit Cost increase $0.269M ($28.160M to $28.429M) from FY20 to FY21 is due to inflation.

Date of FY16 First Delivery is based on the actual fielding date.
Date of FY17 First Delivery is based on the actual fielding date.
Date of FY19 First Delivery is based on the G/ATOR FRP contract awarded 7 June 2019.
Date of FY21 First Delivery is based on the G/ATOR FRP contract option to be exercised 18 February 2021.

Date of FY20 First Delivery is  based on a modification to the G/ATOR FRP contract on 6 December 2019 with 2 systems awarded while under the Continuing Resolution. Remaining 2 systems will be awarded NLT 3 Apr 2020. This is an update since the FY20 submit.
Date of FY18 First Delivery is based on the current fielding date.

Name.@footnote: System Unit Cost for FY19 changed from $29.839M to $31.477M based on G/ATOR FRP Contract Award. System Unit Cost for FY20 changed from $28.835M to $28.160M based on G/ATOR FRP Contract Award. System Unit Cost increase $0.269M from FY20 to FY21 due to inflation.

FiscalYear.@footnote: Date of FY19 First Reserve System Delivery is based on the G/ATOR FRP contract awarded 7 June 2019.
Date of FY20 First Delivery is  based on a modification to the G/ATOR FRP contract on 6 December 2019. This is an update since the FY20 submit.

Name.@footnote: Systems Engineering Program Management (SEPM) cost element ended with the GaN LRIP Lot 3 Contract Option in FY18, as it was not negotiated as a separate CLIN within the Firm Fixed Price (FFP), Full Rate Production (FRP) Contract awarded 7 June 2019. SEPM is part of the System Unit Cost.

ECO funding addresses corrective actions from DT1E/IOT&E testing, as well as user community feedback to improve Human Systems Integration (HSI). ECO funding also reduces the number of material/electronic obsolesce issues and ultimately improves future Marine Forces readiness.  FY19/20 ECOs include the Radome and Antenna Support Electronics Covers, GB2 IFF Removal/Manual Alignment, Pallet Communications Support Processor (PCSP) and GB2 Hardware improvements with a focus on reducing Radar Emplacement/Displacement time. The FY20 Active ECOs increase $0.734M from the FY20 request to the FY21 request to accelerate the Warfighter's desired improvements in Radar Emplacement/Displacement time.    FY21 ECOs will continue Pallet Communications Support Processor (PCSP) and GB2 Hardware improvements efforts focusing on reducing Radar Emplacement/Displacement time.

ECO funding addresses corrective actions from DT1E/IOT&E testing, as well as user community feedback to improve Human Systems Integration (HSI). ECO funding also reduces the number of material/electronic obsolesce issues and ultimately improves future Marine Forces readiness.  FY19/20 ECOs include the Radome and Antenna Support Electronics Covers, GB2 IFF Removal/Manual Alignment, Pallet Communications Support Processor (PCSP) and GB2 Hardware improvements with a focus on reducing Radar Emplacement/Displacement time. The FY20 Reserve ECOs increase $0.352M from the FY20 request to the FY21 request to accelerate the Warfighter's desired improvements in Radar Emplacement/Displacement time.

DMS/NRE & CEG Shelter Integration (Active) is a one-time purchase in FY20 covering all known diminishing manufacturing sources/material shortages (DMS/MS) issues.  This is an update from the FY20 request.
DMS/NRE & CEG Shelter Integration is a one-time purchase in FY20 covering all known diminishing manufacturing sources/material shortages (DMS/MS) issues.  This is an update from the FY20 request.

Funding supports Depot Facilitization (tooling) for Line Replaceable Unit (LRU) Repair and Inspect and Repair Only As Necessary (IROAN) activities at Tobyhanna Army Depot.  FY21 begins the IROAN portion of the Depot Facilitization effort.

This requirement is derived from Change 4 of G/ATOR Block 2 Capabilities Development Document. The CEG Shelter is comprised of an S-788 Shelter on an up-armored HMMWV, providing the G/ATOR system with operator interfaces and communications processing.  The CEG Shelter is an integral component of the G/ATOR System and supports external Command and Control voice and digital communications to CAC2S, CTN, and AFATDS.   The FY20 $3.794M increase from the FY20 request to the FY21 request reflects the purchase, assembly and integration of GFE components for ten (10) vice eight (8) CEG Shelters in order to meet the needs of the GB2 user community.  These CEG Shelters will include a significant design change to improve Environmental, Electromagnetic and Noise mitigation. FY21 decreases $1.845M from FY20 in the FY21 submit as it produces a total of eight (8) CEG Shelters.

GaN Retrofit Kits support the modification of six (6) total GaAS LRIP Systems to the GaN configuration with completion expected in FY23.  The first three (3) Mod kits, $17M, will be installed in FY22 (LRIP Tech Refresh) and the second three (3) Mod kits, $17M, will be installed in FY23 (LRIP Tech Refresh). FY21 is the appropriate time to begin procurement of the first three GaN Retrofit Kits as the initial LRIP system will have over 6 years in service meeting Depot IROAN criteria.

This is a new item for Full Rate Production that was not in the FY20 request. Power Equipment Group (PEG) Pallets are primarily composed of Government Furnished Equipment thus they are now being assembled and integrated by Tobyhanna Army Depot vice the Prime Contractor.

Radar Decoys are hardware that ensures our forces possess the capabilities required to mitigate threats thus increasing the survivability of the radar system against anti-radiation missiles in a Peer, Near-Peer Competitive environment.
With G/ATOR being post FRP, program management support completely migrated from RDT&E to PMC funding in FY19.

G/ATOR's product support strategy employs a combination of Contractor Logistics Support (CLS) and Interim Contactor Logistics Support (ICLS) while the program begins to migrate towards an organic maintenance strategy during the Full Rate Production phase supporting all G/ATOR's. Contractor Logistics Support/Interim Contactor Logistics Support (CLS/ICLS) will continue to partially support fifteen (15) fielded G/ATOR LRIP systems and 2 FRP Systems in FY21 to include their maintenance and repair prior to fielding. Additionally, funding will be used to capture necessary usage data in preparation for organic logistics support, complete provisioning requirements, update the Interactive Electronic Training Manual (ITEM) for new software builds and to prepare and conduct several New Equipment Training (NET) events in FY21. These additional CLS efforts will continue through the Production and Deployment phase of the G/ATOR System.  FY20 column $3.372M increase from the FY20 request to the FY21 request reflects the negotiated/planned Logistics costs for Fielded Systems Repair and Maintenance, CLS for Pre-Fielded Systems, New Equipment Training and Prime Contractor Logistic Planning support.
